meanings.definition: A council or committee that serves as the governing body of an organization.
meanings.sent1: The presidiums met to discuss important decisions for the organization.
meanings.sent2: The presidiums were responsible for making key choices for the group.
meanings.sent3: The presidiums had a lively debate about the best course of action.
meanings.sent4: In the world of the organization, the presidiums were the guiding stars.
meanings.sent5: The presidiums' role was crucial in steering the organization towards success.

meanings.definition: The office or position of a presiding officer.
meanings.sent1: She was honored to be appointed to the presidiums of the board.
meanings.sent2: The presidiums of the meeting ensured everything ran smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The presidiums of the event greeted guests with warmth and charm.
meanings.sent4: As the presidiums of the ceremony, he led with grace and authority.
meanings.sent5: Her role as part of the presidiums brought a sense of order to the proceedings.

meanings.definition: A group of leaders or officials who oversee a specific area or function.
meanings.sent1: The presidiums of the department worked together to achieve common goals.
meanings.sent2: In the company, the presidiums were in charge of different departments.
meanings.sent3: The presidiums of the project collaborated effectively to meet deadlines.
meanings.sent4: The presidiums of the team ensured tasks were completed on time.
meanings.sent5: Each member of the presidiums brought unique skills to the table for success.
